issue.title: Signal-distribution assumes signal values are integers

content.raw:
Comment [#1](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=9#c1) originally posted by ericr86 on 2010-08-31T21:58:57.000Z:

There needs to be some sort of binning. This is already one of the most inefficient parts of segtools. Additionally, it is nice for the bin edges to be numbers that can be represented exactly and conveniently in both decimal and binary floating point. What should we do for other cases? One idea is to set max_bins and min_bins as here, so they are always an integer, but set the bin edges so that there are always at least 1000 bins.
content.html:
Comment [#1](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=9#c1) originally posted by ericr86 on 2010-08-31T21:58:57.000Z:

There needs to be some sort of binning. This is already one of the most inefficient parts of segtools. Additionally, it is nice for the bin edges to be numbers that can be represented exactly and conveniently in both decimal and binary floating point. What should we do for other cases? One idea is to set max_bins and min_bins as here, so they are always an integer, but set the bin edges so that there are always at least 1000 bins.
